column5: Anyone own a Lund Fury?  Just lookin for some reviews!!
Try Walleye Central's Boat forum, there have been numerous posts over the last yeat on this boat. http://www.walleyecentral.com/
Friend of mine has one. Bought it last year. It's really nice boat.
Thanks, I'll definatly check it out!
Sweet! does he have the tiller or the SS. I might break down and buy one ha ha
There are and will be a lot of good deals on solid used units all the time. Quite a ways to go before the water softens up again. A great time to shop around.
He has a tiller. 25 Merc with power trim and 55 lbs terrova i-pilot.
My hunting partner bought one this year. 16fter with a 40 yammy tiller. Nice rig. I like it.  S.
What about a Lund Alaskan 1800 anyone?
The Alaskan is another really nice rig. I had an 18' Alaskan for a number of years.
Ya they look awesome. I'm looking for a good boat for Lake Huron waters and other lakes! so I'm thinking the Alaskan is a better choice!
The Alaskans are a little skinny. Check out some other manufactureres. There is a lot more than just Lund out there. Wouldn't be my first choice, thats for sure.  S.
I think someone on this board just bought one last year around this time.

The console version of the boat was at the Sportsman show today.  Perhaps it will be at the show next weekend too.  It looked like a well laid out boat.  The layout was actually quite similar to my old Alumacraft Lunker 16.  The Fury had a nicer finish though.
Saw the fury at the show.  I liked the rear seats that fold down and convert into a casting deck.
